dt: {bc}the common venomous viper ({it}Vipera berus{/it}) of Europe
{bc}any of various snakes of the viper family {dx}compare {dxt|puff adder||}{/dx}
{bc}any of several North American snakes (such as the hognose snakes) that are harmless but are popularly believed to be venomous

et: Middle English {it}addre, eddre,{/it} alteration (resulting from misdivision of {it}a naddre{/it}) of {it}naddre, neddre,{/it} going back to Old English {it}nǣdre{/it} "adder, snake," going back to West Germanic {it}nēdrōn-{/it} (whence also Old Saxon {it}nādra{/it} "grass snake [{it}Natrix natrix{/it} or allied species]," Old High German {it}nātara, nāter{/it}), going back to dialectal (western) Indo-European {it}*neh{inf}1{/inf}tr-,{/it} full-grade ablaut of {it}*nh{inf}1{/inf}tr-{/it} (whence Old Norse {it}naðr{/it} "adder, snake," Gothic {it}nadrs{/it} "snake, viper," Latin {it}natric-, natrix{/it} "water snake [as {it}Natrix maura{/it}]," Old Irish {it}nathir{/it} [genitive singular {it}nathrach{/it}] "snake," Welsh {it}neidr{/it} [plural {it}nadredd{/it}], Breton {it}aer, naer{/it} "grass snake"), perhaps from {it}*(s)neh{inf}1{/inf}-{/it} "twist together, spin" + {it}*-tr-, -ter-,{/it} agent suffix (hence "one who winds, twists") {ma}{mat|needle:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: the common venomous viper (Vipera berus) of Europe; broadly : any of various snakes of the viper family
any of several North American snakes (such as the hognose snakes) that are harmless but are popularly believed to be venomous

dt: {bc}a device (as in a computer) that performs addition

shortdef: one that adds; especially : a device (as in a computer) that performs addition

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Ophioglossum{/it}, family Ophioglossaceae) of small ferns having a spore-bearing stalk resembling a serpent's tongue

shortdef: any of a genus (Ophioglossum, family Ophioglossaceae) of small ferns having a spore-bearing stalk resembling a serpent's tongue

dt: {bc}a large thick-bodied extremely venomous African viper ({it}Bitis arietans{/it})

shortdef: a large thick-bodied extremely venomous African viper (Bitis arietans)

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Heterodon{/it}) of rather small harmless stout-bodied North American colubrid snakes with keeled scales and an upturned snout that seldom bite but hiss wildly and often play dead when disturbed

shortdef: any of a genus (Heterodon) of rather small harmless stout-bodied North American colubrid snakes with keeled scales and an upturned snout that seldom bite but hiss wildly and often play dead when disturbed —called also hog-nosed snake, puff adder
